values.alignmentText: Seattle's evergreens, Puget Sound views, and strict stormwater rules keep neighborhoods lush, though industrial SoDo corridors still need air monitoring.
Climate models warn of more wildfire smoke and king tide flooding, yet Seattle remains safer than many U.S. metros if we plan for air-quality disruptions.
Cool summers and drizzly winters give long stretches of mild temps, though the grey season can feel endless without sunlight lamps.
Most of the year PM2.5 stays near 8 µg/m³, but August wildfire smoke from Eastern Washington can send AQI above 150, so we'd keep filters ready.
Seattle avoids hurricanes but lives with Cascadia earthquake risk, lahar evacuation routes, and occasional ice storms that can knock out power.
March–May highs climb from 12 °C (54 °F) to 18 °C (65 °F) with light rain and cherry blossoms, ideal for park outings in layers.
Typical highs stay near 24 °C (75 °F) with low humidity; occasional heat waves hit 32 °C (90 °F) but cool off overnight by the water.
September offers crisp 20 °C (68 °F) days before rain returns and highs dip toward 12 °C (54 °F) by November.
Winters hover around 2–8 °C (36–46 °F); snow is rare but wet cold and short daylight require cozy indoor plans.
Alki and Golden Gardens offer pebbly beaches with cold Puget Sound water—great for bonfires and tidepools rather than warm swims.
Ferries to the San Juans, day trips to Olympic National Park, and Mount Rainier hikes keep world-class scenery within two hours.
Seattle's 2024 minimum wage sits around $19/hour, supporting service workers better than most U.S. cities though housing still strains budgets.
Amazon, Microsoft, and Google routinely offer $170k–$220k total comp for senior engineers, keeping Trey and Sarah well above local medians.
Microsoft's Redmond campus anchors .NET demand, with AWS, Expedia, and healthcare systems hiring C# teams nonstop.
Seattle's startup scene and consultancies like Substantial still use Ruby, though opportunities are fewer than for JavaScript or cloud roles.
West Coast tech embraces hybrid-first policies; it's easy to secure remote roles with occasional Seattle office visits.
Seattle balances a tech hustle with outdoorsy weekends; traffic can spike but neighborhoods like Ballard or West Seattle keep a calmer rhythm.
Schools run 08:55–15:25; big tech often expects 10:00–18:00 overlap with other time zones, so we'd rely on after-school STEM clubs or flexible hours.
Washington's Working Connections Child Care subsidy helps lower-income families, but middle-income parents still face $1,500+ monthly daycare bills.
Visa holders qualify for subsidies only after residency proofs and income tests; expect to pay market rates while paperwork processes.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries

values.alignmentText: Capitol Hill clubs, Belltown jazz bars, and the Seattle Symphony offer varied nightlife with a creative lean.
Kayaking on Lake Union, skiing at Snoqualmie, and backpacking in the Cascades keep world-class nature minutes away.
Median three-bedroom rents top $3,200 and bidding wars remain common in walkable neighborhoods like Capitol Hill or Queen Anne.
Violent crime is moderate but property crime and car break-ins are frequent; we'd invest in secure parking and home security.
Link light rail expansion, RapidRide buses, and water taxis support car-light living, though late-night coverage and Eastside links remain limited.
No state income tax helps, but high housing, childcare, and B&O taxes push Seattle budgets well above Midwestern levels.
Microsoft, Bungie, Valve, and numerous VR startups hire year-round, making Seattle one of the strongest U.S. hubs for Trey's skills.

As noted in Game Dev Work Prospects, Microsoft, Bungie, Valve, and numerous VR startups hire year-round, making Seattle one of the strongest U.S. hubs for Trey's skills. Hiring velocity at established studios in Seattle moves quickly, often closing offers within a few weeks.

Compensation lands at the top of global ranges with premium base pay, bonuses, and stock. When opportunities surface in Seattle, established studios benchmark offers against peers across the ecosystem.
Established studios in Seattle rely on English for cross-border collaboration, while local-language fluency remains important for community, compliance, and platform partnerships.
Remote expectations at established studios in Seattle are highly flexible, with distributed teams normalized and relocation optional.
Home to 343 Industries, Bungie, Valve, and indie darlings like Campo Santo's partners, Seattle concentrates AAA and indie talent.
Seattle Indies Expo, Global Game Jam, and access to Xbox and Amazon grant programs support founders despite high burn rates.

Startup founders report that Seattle Indies Expo, Global Game Jam, and access to Xbox and Amazon grant programs support founders despite high burn rates. Hiring velocity at early-stage studios in Seattle wraps searches within a month or two as pipelines stay active.
Compensation remains competitive with other major hubs, mixing solid base pay and performance bonuses. Early teams in Seattle balance cash and equity to stay competitive while managing runway.
Founding teams in Seattle lean on English for investor and platform communication, while local-language fluency helps with hiring, compliance, and community outreach.
Remote expectations among startups in Seattle are flexible for senior roles, with hybrid schedules common.
Gigabit fiber, electrified buses, and SEA's international flights keep infrastructure modern, though road maintenance lags in some neighborhoods.
Frequent abrupt changes make certain months feel unstable with several days of hazardous conditions that push us indoors.
Deep winter gloom lasts several weeks, so we plan strict routines, supplements, and possible getaways to maintain morale.
Roughly half the year is wonderful, half demands planning around heat, cold, or rain to enjoy time outside.
High living costs erode quality of life; reliable childcare or healthcare coverage often falls through the cracks.
We feel squeezed: decent neighborhoods or schools require long commutes or high costs that crowd out enrichment.
Luxury services are thin; wealth management and elite schooling often require another city.

values.key: Spacious Housing Benchmark (2k sq ft Rent)
values.alignmentText: Spacious rentals are rare; we likely settle for smaller homes or relocate to a different metro.
Sidewalks cover key areas but drivers often rush, so we stay alert with children.
Stigma or limited providers make it harder to secure consistent care.
Higher cancer rates tie to environmental or lifestyle factors we must actively mitigate.
Resilience is good with occasional layoffs offset by quick reemployment.
